description: Former Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen has withdrawn from the PSL auction for two new franchises being held in Islamabad. Announcing his decision on X, Tareen said his PSL journey was about representing South Punjab, not business. He plans to watch as a fan this year but hinted at a return if Multan is sold again. Nine bidders remain in the race.

description: The timing matters. Oil prices are already under pressure globally, and petrol prices have eased after years of inflation-driven pain. The Venezuela pitch is being sold as a way to lock that relief in.

description: The US Consulate General in Mumbai has issued a warning to B1/B2 visitor visa holders regarding unauthorized employment. Engaging in work activities not permitted by the visa can lead to deportation and a potential lifetime ban from entering the United States. Travelers are advised to understand visa regulations before planning their trips.

'Donroe' doctrine: 5 reasons why Trump's Maduro shock was not about oil. It was a msg for Xi
description: The US seizure of Nicolas Maduro and control over Venezuela's oil marks a significant blow to China's influence in Latin America. This move, rerouting billions in crude to the US, undermines Beijing's decade-long economic diplomacy and its strategy of championing sovereignty. It signals that economic ties don't guarantee protection against US military power.

title: 'Axis of war': Russia warns EU over peacekeeping force in Ukraine; takes shot at US
description: Russia has branded Ukraine and its allies an "axis of war," calling the proposed peacekeeping force deployments plan "dangerous" and "destructive". Moscow warned that any such troops would be considered legitimate military targets. This strong reaction follows new security guarantees announced for Kyiv. Meanwhile, the US seized a Russian-flagged tanker, which Moscow claims will escalate tensions.

From Op Sindoor to Venezuela: How Chinese weapons, radars keep failing — Explained
description: China's arms exports faced a significant setback as its weapons, including air defence systems like the HQ-9 and JY-27A radar, proved ineffective during India's Operation Sindoor and a recent Venezuelan operation. These incidents highlighted a technological gap, with Russian-supplied missiles also failing to perform. The failures have damaged China's reputation as a reliable arms supplier.

Hindu man lynched in Bangladesh: Main accused held; 21 arrested so far
description: Police arrested Yasin Arafat, the main suspect in the murder of Hindu worker Dipu Chandra Das. Arafat, a former madrasa teacher, allegedly led a mob that attacked and killed Das. This incident follows a period of unrest in Bangladesh. Twenty-one people have been arrested in connection with the case. Nine have given confessional statements.

title: Exclusive: Why no Hikaru? Inside new FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship
description: FIDE and Freestyle Chess ended a long-running dispute over world championship authority by agreeing to stage the first official FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship. The conflict began in late 2024 over title rights, sparking public clashes and player concerns. A renewed dialogue in 2025 led to reconciliation, aligning Freestyle’s tour with FIDE governance and creating a unified championship framework.

AI, IT and yes, booze too: Gujarat’s big GIFT City push
description: Gujarat is launching a major push into AI and the digital economy with a dedicated IT-AI cluster near GIFT City and the establishment of the Indian AI Research Organisation (IAIRO). These initiatives aim to attract global tech giants, foster innovation, and position the state as a national and global hub for emerging technologies.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis hints Google triggered OpenAI ‘Code Red’
description: Google's Gemini is rapidly gaining ground on ChatGPT, showing significant month-over-month growth and capturing a substantial portion of its rival's audience. This surge has prompted OpenAI to issue an internal 'code red' warning, as Google's integrated infrastructure and full-stack approach appear to be giving it a decisive edge in the competitive AI chatbot landscape.

title: The heat of air conditioners: How climate change is driving up power bills— a closer look
description: Soaring temperatures are escalating global electricity demand, particularly for cooling, leading to price hikes and straining energy grids. India's consumption is surging, with a heavy reliance on coal exacerbating emissions. While renewable energy is growing, the article highlights the urgent need for cleaner solutions to prevent electricity from fueling the climate crisis it aims to combat.

title: ‘Bramayugam’: Mammootty film enters Oscar Academy space
description: Mammootty's film 'Bramayugam' is set for a prestigious screening at the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures in Los Angeles on February 12, 2026. This marks the first time a Mammootty-starrer will be shown at the museum, as part of the 'Where the Forest Meets the Sea' folk horror series.

title: Candace Owens questions Charlie Kirk after sharing unseen image with no blood
description: Candace Owens shared claims about a photo she says shows Charlie Kirk after an alleged shooting. She questioned the official story and named people she said could not be trusted. However, there is no verified evidence, police record, or official confirmation that Charlie Kirk was shot or killed. Her statements remain unproven and widely disputed.

title: Did Sidda celebrate record of longest-serving CM prematurely?
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's supporters celebrated a 'country chicken feast' for his tenure, though the official record as longest-serving CM is days away. Political analysts questioned the premature fanfare amidst speculation about leadership changes.  Siddaramaiah, however, highlighted his government's achievements and dismissed opposition criticism.

title: Philanthropy push: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife donates billions to non-profits; biggest giveaway in 2025
description: Mackenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon's founder, has significantly reduced her stake in the e-commerce giant, selling shares worth $13 billion.  She continues her massive philanthropic efforts, donating $7.1 billion to non-profits in 2025 alone, including over $1.2 billion to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  These substantial, unrestricted grants are seen as a counterpoint to tech companies scaling back DEI initiatives.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
description: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy ideas, from EVs and solar to massive battery production. He highlighted China's dominance in these sectors, contrasting it with US potential. Musk emphasized batteries, like Tesla's Megapacks, as crucial for doubling US energy throughput without new power plants, especially for AI's growing demands.

title: Tommy Fleetwood & Clare Fleetwood net worth: Golf earnings, sponsors, family
description: Tommy and Clare Fleetwood have built a significant fortune through Tommy's successful golf career, prize money, and lucrative brand deals. Clare, as his manager, plays a crucial role in their financial success and their private family life. Their collaborative approach has led to both on-course achievements and long-term financial stability.

title: Travis Kelce hits breaking point as Taylor Swift reaches new career high
description: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.
